title: ENCODE Antibody lot
description: Schema for submitting an ENCODE Antibody (no target or validation information)
comment: Each ENCODE antibody lot is a unique combination of source, product ID and lot number

schema-version.description: The version of JSON schema files used in the generation of the example
schema-version.comment: Must match the specific schema's `version` property

source.comment: Programmatic submitters can supply an ENCODE source UUID or unique Source name
source.title: Antibody source

lot_id.description: The vendor's id code for the antibody lot
lot_id.comment: The lot ID supplied by the vendor
lot_id.title: Antibody lot id

product_id.comment: The product or catalog number supplied by the vendor
product_id.title: Antibody product id

lot_id_alias.comment: For lots deemed to be exactly the same by the vendor, the lot ids may be aliases for one another
lot_id_alias.title: Lot id alias

antigen_description.description: Description of the antigen used in raising the antibody
antigen_description.comment: A description, such as the amino acid residue locations of the antigen used to raise the antibody
antigen_description.title: Antigen description

antigen_sequence.description: Sequence of the antigen used in raising the antibody
antigen_sequence.comment: The amino acid sequence of the antigen used to raise the antibody
antigen_sequence.title: Antigen sequence

clonality.description: Indicate whether the antibody is mono- or polyclonal
clonality.title: Antibody clonality

encode2_dbxrefs.description: List cross-references to the previous ENCODE system
encode2_dbxrefs.comment: Cross-references used in previous ENCODE systems can be found in the antibody column: http://encodeproject.org/ENCODE/antibodies.html
encode2_dbxrefs.title: ENCODE2 DBXREFs

host_organism.comment: Programmatic submitters can provide the exact Organism name or UUID for the host organism the antibody was raised in
host_organism.title: Host organism

isotype.description: Isotype of the antibody (IgA, IgD, etc.)
isotype.comment: Choose an isotype from the different enumerated antibody classes
isotype.title: Antibody isotype

purifications.description: Method by which antibody was purified
purifications.comment: Choose a method by which the antibody was purified from the enumerated list
purifications.title: Purification methods

url.description: External URL for the specific antibody at vendor site
url.comment: Provide an URL for the vendor's page for the specified antibody lot, if available
url.title: External url
